name: Andy Ricker's Naam Jim Kai Yaang (Tamarind dipping sauce)
description: This tangy tamarind dipping sauce is served with Andy Ricker's Whole Roasted Young Chicken from his new Pok Pok cookbook.
recipeIngredient: 1 ounces seedless tamarind pulp (also called tamarind paste)
1 tablespoon Phrik Phon Khua (Toasted-chile powder), or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the palm sugar, fish sauce, tamarind pulp, and water in a medium pot. Set the pot over high heat, bring the mixture to a boil, then immediately decrease the heat to maintain a simmer. Use a whisk or spoon to break up the palm sugar and tamarind pulp as they soften, and cook just until the tamarind has fully softened and dissolved into the mixture, 5 to 8 minutes
Stir in the chile powder, turn off the heat, and let the mixture sit, stirring occasionally, until it has cooled to room temperature.
